content.value: Detect sickness in pets through uncharacteristic movement.
Use in sports like running to identify areas for improvement in runners' strides, and improve on athletic performance
Could be used in cooking, to determine the extent to which water is boiling.
to find lost livestock
Security identification of people, as well as emergency weather and dangerous phenomenon.
The technology can be used to monitor air craft.
The technology can be used to investigate how many active wild animals there are in the field.

the device could be used in a detective manner that is to say that it could be useful to predicting behavioral patterns of say criminal offenders, students, to perform research perhaps by tracking the physical lives of athletes or top achieving businessman or for companies to isolate expected behaviors of their employees and how they anticipate employees to move during a work day to establish fair and true standards
send it into a tornado or hurricane to help get pattern and weather data

This could be used to detect cancers that may be in their earliest forms.  For example, if we know what a normal liver looks like, if it were scanned and even the most microscopic change was present, this technology you detect it.
It might be used as an alternative means of identity verification.
This could also be used to locate and follow individuals who are participating in events like triathlons, marathons, and other outdoor sports. (Last submission had a typo.)
It can be used for detecting movement in front of doors and automatically opening them.
This technology could be used to extrapolate walking data from pedestrians moving about and use the data to construct optimal street layouts for efficient walking and crosswalks.
Helping firefighters in ways to get into a house that is on fire. Which way they should go, and if anybody is inside.
It could be used to monitor pedestrian traffic on the sidewalks or crosswalks so that lights don't change when people are in the middle of them or to report in an app when it is most busy.
can be used to find people covered in an avalanche
baby rocker with vibrations, motion sensor and proximity sensor that enable a child and caretaker know baby welfare, can also indicate temperature change and  baby comfort
it could monitor children or animals when not able to watch them directly and to watch for any actions that aren't familiar with the system.

this tech can be stationed around casinos to detect any known sleight of hand movements that might be used for cheating purposes.

This technology can be used to explore and map deeper parts of the ocean where visibility is either low or non-existent. Hooking up this device to a machine that can withstand the deep depths of the ocean, we can now explore parts of the ocean that we may not have been able to do before.
Observation of activity in deep-sea trenches.
color aid identification , helps identify color when matched with an object to help in learning colors

I think aquariums would make great use of this technology. They could monitor their tasks for activities over a period of time to figure out patterns of species and how they may interact with each other.
this technology can be applied to vehicles and used for safety measures like parameter detection to activate braking or parking assist.
I can see where people are in my home when I am not there.
It can be used by police in conjunction with police scanners to identify the type or size of the vehicle or object. This could aid in low light or inclement weather conditions.
Use on fire helmets to help identify people in burning buildings
Read body language of the person you're talking to and give real time feedback to an ear piece you are wearing.
Missile defense system in the military.
The technology would be useful for adventurers in far regions of the world. Hikers, mountaineers, survivalists.

This technology would be perfect as a health and fitness tracker. With both features combined, a persons vitals, body temperature, mood, BMI, etc could be tested 24 hours a day with this kind of 3D tracking turned into a hand sized device.
It could be used at your front door in order to unlock the house when it saw you or family members approaching, like it would be able to recognize your gait/movement.
learn how fast an animal moves on average
Like throwing a basketball in a goal would make the objects make a faster movement because of their attention span. Keep the objects close together as if they are humans.

You can use this to help blind people detect areas of high danger such as roads, holes, and other places. It can help blind people keep track of where they are or help them cross the road. It can help them avoid people or fall into a hole. The technology would buzz or make a sound when it detects danger.
Can detect a potential robbery if used in stores to record previous motions that resulted in armed robbery. Will alert if actions are similar of customers in the store.

An application could be created for pet owners who have pets who have ran away from home. The application could be downloaded right onto a persons phone. the hand sized device could be put into a collar of a pet, or a chip like device under the skin. The system would be able to pin point a pets location to the direct coordinates.
an alarm system that detects movement, records it, sets off an alarm.

Like using an example of a baseball game where the person in the outfield is headed to the base to catch the player before it get there. The technology can recognize objects coming near them.
safety during air travel
Mapping eye movements to improve performance in sports.
This could help me when I am jogging to warn me about bad weather and heavy traffic. It could also plan my best route.

it can be used for a child, if a child is having problems at school like if someone is bullying them this tech can identify the movement of the other person the bully in this situation and it can collect the info and when the parents or the teacher need proof it will be in the form of the objects. So they know exactly what was going on if the person being bullied was hit or verbally abused or any other things.
as a sensor on a car
To use in wildlife research, where movement triggers a camera.

Integration into cars, both self driving and traditional

This technology could be used to help golfers analyze and improve their golf swing. It can detect the persons movements and determine what is wrong with their swing so that it can be improved. It can also detect what they are doing right so that they knwo that they won't have to work on that aspect of their swing.
Helps to study weather patterns for future prediction improvements.
This could identify and locate children during extracurricular activities or field trips.

This technology could be life saving for babies who are born prematurely. Their heart rate, breathing patterns, body temperature, oxygen levels and so much more could be accurately tested all day and night. Any alarming change could be reported by the artificial intelligence. All of the wires could be eliminated by this technology.

I think one thing that i think is very interesting to do is if it can analyze movements i think  it would me amazing at optimizing speed and finding patterns to help push not only people to their fullest potential but also objects. Trying to find patterns that humans use at max speed and we can further that and our limits would probably be topped.
It could be incorporated into surveillance cameras for both night and day use.
It could be used in space on advanced telescopes to spot incoming large objects that could be potential threats to the planet.
Use it as a security device to detect if unknown people are attempting to enter a house by looking at their movement patterns.
This could track migration patterns in animals and birds or other wildlife that do not live in the ocean.
The technology can be used to observe the motion of waves in an attempt to explain the rogue wave phenomenon.

The way this technology can be used is by detecting the flow of people. For example in a crowded area, if we  can study the way people move, the flow of the crowd and where they go, we can design large areas to be more open. One specific place would be an airport, if we can utilize this technology and learn where people tend to walk, where people tend to gravitate to when going through an airport.  From personal experience I have seen that people tend to 'clog up' a certain area when they go through an airport. If the technology could figure out how we can design a large space, we could better prevent long lines, and too many people crowded in a space.
This technology can be used to navigate through conditions of low visibility by scanning one's surroundings and providing directions.
It can be used as a home security device.  It can recognize the people and animal movements that are usually inside the home and alert when there is an unfamiliar movement.
Assisting SWAT teams on the locations of perpetrators before a RAID
The technology would be useful for researchers trying to gauge population of animal species over large areas of land and water.
home security system of the future.
Can be used to identify landmarks and locations for people who are bad at directions or using maps.
Can be a great addition to the health sector
This technology could be used for night vision.
Could be used by the Space Station to detect and analyze oncoming objects.

An application that monitors suspicious activity outside a business.  Many atrocities could be avoided if a person had this device hidden in their store front.  This could be useful in first detecting threats, and second artificial intelligence which can lock all doors if a weapon or threatening person is approaching.
I could see when person left my home.

watch movement outside your house or business
You can use it to gather data on large metro areas. Information on traffic, both human and vehicle for optimization.
This could be used in battlefield conditions to detect enemy movement and threats to troops.

this technology would work as a primary identification device for parents to use on their children, so that when the child is not with them they are able to monitor their movements, ensure they are on standard paths, say the child deters from a common route they will then be flagged. Not so much to be used in the way of a camera to constantly trace movements but rather to submit notifications to the parents when the child moves from a certain region or range and is not where they should be or where they've been allowed to be.
There's definitely a military/combat use
It can be used to detect lack of movement in patients/subscribers who need attention, such as elderly or physically impaired people who may fall and not be able to get up.
Fish finder

can be used as a trap for speedster, not necessarily a trap but it will recognize people that speed in the same neighborhood all the time, not also in the same neighborhood but speeding in general. It will track their pattern and then it can also be modified to log their license plates so people like this can be apprehended and dealt with before they cause harm to the public with their aggressive behavior.
Use for security cameras to only record when human motion is detected

It could be helpful in malls to identify shoppers and what their habits were along with heling to move stores and move marketing. It could show habits and help people to sell better along with being great advertiser research.
As a sensor on rovers or other vehicles we send into space.
Use during football games for teams to analyze the opponents' play.

I believe this technology could be used to make simple things more convenient for people. By tracking and predicting your movements, the technology could be paired with other devices and could sense when to begin certain process. For example, it could detect your typical movement patterns in the morning and know when to turn on your shower for you so the water is warm, know when to begin brewing your coffee, and when to remote start your car. That way you can go through your morning quickly and efficiently without having to manually do all of these processes.
Can be used by elite athletes and their coaches in some way to benefit and enhance their performance
police body camera

A handheld device that you can take to the lake to fish. Like a fish locator on a boat, this device will have mapped out the entire lake area and you will be shown the groups and populations as well as the group movements of groups of fish within the entire realm of the lake rather than just localized by your location on the lake. A first glance at the population of fish in the whole lake and where they are and how they move.
baby sleep/health monitor
the tracking feature could be used on animals in game reserve to monitor tracking and could even be used to catch poachers or other animal poaching activities which might lead to poaching
The technology would be useful to CGI artists and filmmakers trying replicate human or animal movement with thier CGI characters.
To help with 3D modeling
intruder detection

This  technology could be placed into a persons vehicle in order to first keep track of their location, and secondly monitor the conditions of the weather. If a person was to go off road with this kind of technology in the vehicle the AI would be able to alert proper authorities if the person has no access to a phone. This kind of technology would save the lives of many in dire situations.
The technology can be used by farmers trying to locate their flock in foggy or inclement weather.
It could be used for military technology to predict precisely where a bullet or missile will hit so that less mistakes would be make in combat.
Use it to identify fouls or false starts in sporting events.
Teaching children the names and sounds of objects: for instance, if integrated into a child's toy, the technology can say the names of objects that the toy is pointed at.
It could be an assistant for a physical therapist. Recording and comparing minor changes in movements could give them additional insights.

It can be put on a baby right after they are born at the hospital. That way there would be no chance of another parent switching babies at birth or someone stealing your newborn. It will not cause any hard to the child. All it will do is be put on the arms or the legs in form of a strap or bracelet so that it wont and cant be easily cut or removed. Finding people lost at sea

Could be used in artistic endeavors like choreography, where the technology could detect how moving objects relate to each other in space. The technology could then be used to create a reactive set of motions based on the data provided by the technology.

I would be able to see people moving in my home at nighttime.

The technology I'm thinking about is a hand-held computer or modular that can detect a person who might be undetectable in certain clothing, weather, etc. For example, let's say a store is getting robbed. It's raining, he is wearing clothes that conceals his identity, and it makes it nearly impossible for cameras or the human eye to detect who it is. With this device, it has a camera-like operation that can scan and detect who the person is, the height, weight, etc, and help the cops identify who the person is, rather than having to guess. With this item being present in most stores, it would make the store owners a lot more secure and it would help the cops detect and identify who the perpetrators are.

it could be used in farming to track herds of cattle or other farm animals. it can make it so that farmers can see where the heard is on large plots of land by installing several of these devices around their property and can look for any unusual behavior in the animals which would leave them free to do other tasks
using the tech to monitor wild animals in their natural habitat

A camera system that can detect individuals by the unique way they walk. This would help in catching criminals or persons of interest, missing people, etc. An issue maybe though we don't know how unique individuals movements (walking) are. We use dental implants and hair as though they're unique but they aren't, they're unique to an extent. Even DNA has its flaws, as an identical twin can have the same or similar DNA, while people who have received donated organs can have the donors DNA in them. While video technology that can identify individuals movements based on uniqueness would be helpful, we'd have to treat it like dental impressions or hair collection, not an exact science.
Use it as a sensor in your smart home to detect if people (or pets) are moving around to turn lights on and off.
If in every area of the city, it would be virtually impossible for criminals to escape the police through the tracking offered by these devices.

This technology can be used on a vehicle  to assist drivers when driving in bad weather. It would come in handy when drivers need assistance seeing in bad weather or driving conditions that make it difficult to see. It would be designed in a way that makes it user friendly and easy to install on the front of the vehicle and gives access through the persons phone via an app.

Put the tech on grocery store shelves and when the product is close to running out it can notify a stockier that it needs to be stocked. If there is none in the back room the tech then can automatically request another shipment from the distribution center. Making it so stores have less turn around times for products.

I think this technology could replace MRI and CAT scans, or at least be a viable alternative.  It would be a quicker scan than the other two.  It could be transported much easier.  If you had immobile patients, they would be able to be scanned and diagnosed easier.

Use it in self driving cars. The tech would be able to tell when it was going to crash into something or if something is coming to close to the car. I feel like this would make self driving cars safer and more reliable.

when hunting to sense prey moving
Use the device as an adjunct to surveillance cameras to identify specific individuals. The information could be used for identification in cases of crimes, accidents, etc.

This device would be really good in identifying people in a security type setting. It may be possible to implement this technology into security cameras or surveillance.  For example, if a suspect robs a bank, the device could record the movement characteristics before and after the event and would be able to compare this with the movements of suspected individuals.  This may help in positively identifying the criminal.  This device may also be perfect for law enforcement to have within or mounted on their patrol vehicles.  The device can scan pedestrian movements while driving and notify the police of positive matches to a database of stored suspected criminal movement characteristics.

I think this new technology can be used for helping the blind. With this technology and a little bit of adding on another device that can communicate with its wearer, this technology can give a person who suffers from blindness the ability to detect and avoid objects within their surroundings without eyesight. The technology would work like its supposed to, detecting the movement of objects then relay that information to another device that is solely built to comprehend the information and to communicate it to the person wearing the device. Its not a perfect solution, but I believe its a good step in helping blind people function better in the outside world.
watch how animals move
